taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Adults inhabit heavily vegetated standing to slow-flowing fresh and brackish water.  They feed on worms, crustaceans and plant matter (Ref. 7020).  A truly viviparous fish (Ref. 45952).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: North America:  occurs only in the USA from Cape Fear River drainage in North Carolina to southern Louisiana.
dataObjects.references: Page, L.M. and B.M. Burr 1991 A field guide to freshwater fishes of North America north of Mexico. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston. 432 p. (Ref. 5723)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Page, L.M. and B.M. Burr 1991 A field guide to freshwater fishes of North America north of Mexico. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston. 432 p. (Ref. 5723)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: benthopelagic; non-migratory; freshwater; brackish; pH range: 7.0 - 8.0; dH range: 9 - 19

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.description:
Depth range based on 1 specimen in 1 taxon.

Environmental ranges
  Depth range (m): 0.05 - 0.05
 
Note: this information has not been validated. Check this *note*. Your feedback is most welcome.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Associations
dataObjects.title: Known predators
dataObjects.description:
Heterandria formosa (nematodes, mosquito fish, least killifish) is prey of:
Decapoda
Floridichthys carpio
Lophogobius cyprinoides

Based on studies in:
USA: Florida, Everglades (Estuarine)

This list may not be complete but is based on published studies.
dataObjects.references: W. E. Odum and E. J. Heald, The detritus-based food web of an estuarine mangrove community, In Estuarine Research, Vol. 1, Chemistry, Biology and the Estuarine System, Academic Press, New York, pp. 265-286, from p. 281 (1975).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Associations
dataObjects.title: Known prey organisms
dataObjects.description:
Heterandria formosa (nematodes, mosquito fish, least killifish) preys on:
algae
phytoplankton
Nematoda
Crustacea
Polychaeta
Bivalvia
Actinopterygii
Cumacea

Based on studies in:
USA: Florida, Everglades (Estuarine)

This list may not be complete but is based on published studies.
dataObjects.references: W. E. Odum and E. J. Heald, The detritus-based food web of an estuarine mangrove community, In Estuarine Research, Vol. 1, Chemistry, Biology and the Estuarine System, Academic Press, New York, pp. 265-286, from p. 281 (1975).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: A truly viviparous fish, embryo derives nearly all of its nourishment from the mother (Ref. 45952).
